thread.title: High School Football Roundup: Lake overcomes early deficit against Glasgow, Dover, CR, and Polytech fall
thread.title_full: High School Football Roundup: Lake overcomes early deficit against Glasgow, Dover, CR, and Polytech fall

author: Mike Santa Barbara
title: High School Football Roundup: Lake overcomes early deficit against Glasgow, Dover, CR, and Polytech fall
text: High School Football Roundup: Lake overcomes early deficit against Glasgow, Dover, CR, and Polytech fall Comment By Mike Santa Barbara Posted Oct. 23, 2015 @ 10:31 pm Lake Forest 35, Glasgow 27 After falling behind early 19-0, the Lake Forest Spartans were able to bounce back and defeat Glasgow 35-27 in come-from-behind fashion Friday night. Noah Feague-Johnson finished with two touchdowns, one through the air and one on the ground for the Spartans. First, he connected with Ben Moore on a 60-yard touchdown before scoring later in the first half on an 18-yard option run for a touchdown. Tre Milton and Elle Harden added touchdown on the ground for Lake Forest in the victory. The Spartans have now won four in a row and sit at 5-2 on the season. Lake Forest is back in action next Friday on the road against Seaford starting at 7:30 p.m. Caesar Rodney 6, Cape Henlopen 21 Caesar Rodney dropped their fourth game in a row on Friday night, falling to Cape Henlopen 21-6. The loss brings the Riders’ record to 1-6 overall on the season. CR is back in action next week hosting the Smyrna Eagles at 7:30 p.m. Polytech 7, Sussex Tech 56 Polytech’s tough season continued Friday night as they fell to Sussex Tech 56-7. The Panthers remain winless on the year at 0-7. Polytech looks to get into the win column for the first time this year next week when they travel south to take on Sussex Central next Friday night at 7:30 p.m. Dover 7, Salesianum 21 The Dover Senators fell to 3-4 on the year, falling to a very tough Salesianum team Friday night 21-7. The Senators gained an early 7-0 lead which they took into the break but couldn’t overcome 21 second half points from Sallies. Dover is back in action next Friday night when they travel to take on Sussex Tech Ravens at 7:30 p.m.
